Operation 'get-/cms/v3/source-code/extract/async/tasks/{taskId}/status_getAsyncStatus' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary 'Get extraction status' is too generic and doesn't convey the asynchronous nature of the operation. Description lacks clarity about what status information is returned and doesn't explain that this is a polling operation with no side effects. Enhanced version specifies the async context, clarifies the return value includes completion state and error details, and explicitly notes this is a read-only operation suitable for polling. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation (polling for async task results) and what to expect from the response.

data.current_description: Get the status of an extraction by the `taskId` returned from the initial `extract/async` request.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the current status of an asynchronous source code extraction task using the taskId returned from the initial extract/async request. Returns the task status including completion state, progress information, and any error details if the extraction failed. This operation does not modify any state and can be called repeatedly to poll for task completion.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Get extraction status' is too generic and doesn't convey the asynchronous nature of the operation. Description lacks clarity about what status information is returned and doesn't explain that this is a polling operation with no side effects. Enhanced version specifies the async context, clarifies the return value includes completion state and error details, and explicitly notes this is a read-only operation suitable for polling. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation (polling for async task results) and what to expect from the response.

message: Operation 'put-/cms/v3/source-code/{environment}/content/{path}_createOrUpdate' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Description lacks clarity on what happens when a file already exists (replacement behavior) and what is returned. Added explicit side effects (create vs. replace behavior) and return value details to improve AI agent understanding of operation outcomes.

data.current_description: Upserts a file at the specified path in the specified environment. Accepts multipart/form-data content type.
data.description_suggestion: Upserts a file at the specified path in the specified environment. Accepts multipart/form-data content type. Creates a new file if none exists at the path, or replaces the existing file content. Returns the file metadata including creation/modification timestamps and file size.
data.reasoning: Description lacks clarity on what happens when a file already exists (replacement behavior) and what is returned. Added explicit side effects (create vs. replace behavior) and return value details to improve AI agent understanding of operation outcomes.

message: Operation 'post-/cms/v3/source-code/{environment}/content/{path}_create' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details. Added return value details to help AI agents understand what data is available after successful file creation.

data.current_description: Creates a file at the specified path in the specified environment. Accepts multipart/form-data content type. Throws an error if a file already exists at the specified path.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new file at the specified path in the specified environment. Accepts multipart/form-data content type. Returns an error if a file already exists at the specified path. Returns the created file metadata including path, size, and creation timestamp.
data.reasoning: Description clearly states the error condition but lacks information about the successful response. Added return value details to help AI agents understand what data is available after successful file creation.

message: Operation 'delete-/cms/v3/source-code/{environment}/content/{path}_archive' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Operation ID suggests archiving behavior but summary/description indicate deletion. Clarified that this is a permanent deletion (not archival). Added side effects (file removal, non-recoverability) and return value information for better AI agent decision-making about operation consequences.

data.current_description: Deletes the file at the specified path in the specified environment.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes the file at the specified path in the specified environment. The file is removed from the source code repository and cannot be recovered. Returns a confirmation response indicating successful deletion.
data.reasoning: Operation ID suggests archiving behavior but summary/description indicate deletion. Clarified that this is a permanent deletion (not archival). Added side effects (file removal, non-recoverability) and return value information for better AI agent decision-making about operation consequences.

data.current_summary: Validate the contents of a file
data.current_description: Validates the file contents passed to the endpoint given a specified path and environment. Accepts multipart/form-data content type.
data.description_suggestion: Validates file contents against the specified path and environment configuration. Accepts multipart/form-data content type. Returns validation results including any errors or warnings found. Does not modify the file if validation fails.
data.reasoning: Description lacks information about what validation rules are applied, what the response contains, and whether validation has side effects. Added context about validation scope, return value structure, and clarified that validation is non-destructive to help AI agents understand operation behavior and interpret results.

message: Operation 'post-/cms/v3/source-code/extract/async_doAsync' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_context. Summary doesn't indicate asynchronous nature. Description lacks input details (FileExtractRequest schema), return value specifics (task ID), and clarification that operation is non-blocking. Added async context, input/output details, and reference to TaskLocator schema for better AI agent understanding of operation flow and response handling.

data.current_description: Extract a zip file in the developer file system. Extraction status can be checked with the `/extract/async/tasks/taskId/status` endpoint below.
data.description_suggestion: Asynchronously extracts a zip file into the developer file system. Accepts a FileExtractRequest containing the zip file path and target extraction directory. Returns a task identifier (202 Accepted) that can be used to poll extraction status via the `/extract/async/tasks/{taskId}/status` endpoint. Extraction occurs in the background.
data.reasoning: Summary doesn't indicate asynchronous nature. Description lacks input details (FileExtractRequest schema), return value specifics (task ID), and clarification that operation is non-blocking. Added async context, input/output details, and reference to TaskLocator schema for better AI agent understanding of operation flow and response handling.

Operation 'get-/cms/v3/source-code/extract/async/tasks/{taskId}/status_getAsyncStatus' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary 'Get extraction status' is too generic and doesn't convey the asynchronous nature of the operation. Description lacks clarity about what status information is returned and doesn't explain that this is a polling operation with no side effects. Enhanced version specifies the async context, clarifies the return value includes completion state and error details, and explicitly notes this is a read-only operation suitable for polling. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation (polling for async task results) and what to expect from the response.

data.current_description: Get the status of an extraction by the `taskId` returned from the initial `extract/async` request.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the current status of an asynchronous source code extraction task using the taskId returned from the initial extract/async request. Returns the task status including completion state, progress information, and any error details if the extraction failed. This operation does not modify any state and can be called repeatedly to poll for task completion.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Get extraction status' is too generic and doesn't convey the asynchronous nature of the operation. Description lacks clarity about what status information is returned and doesn't explain that this is a polling operation with no side effects. Enhanced version specifies the async context, clarifies the return value includes completion state and error details, and explicitly notes this is a read-only operation suitable for polling. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation (polling for async task results) and what to expect from the response.

message: Operation 'put-/cms/v3/source-code/{environment}/content/{path}_createOrUpdate' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Description lacks clarity on what happens when a file already exists (replacement behavior) and what is returned. Added explicit side effects (create vs. replace behavior) and return value details to improve AI agent understanding of operation outcomes.

data.current_description: Upserts a file at the specified path in the specified environment. Accepts multipart/form-data content type.
data.description_suggestion: Upserts a file at the specified path in the specified environment. Accepts multipart/form-data content type. Creates a new file if none exists at the path, or replaces the existing file content. Returns the file metadata including creation/modification timestamps and file size.
data.reasoning: Description lacks clarity on what happens when a file already exists (replacement behavior) and what is returned. Added explicit side effects (create vs. replace behavior) and return value details to improve AI agent understanding of operation outcomes.

message: Operation 'post-/cms/v3/source-code/{environment}/content/{path}_create' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details. Description clearly states the error condition but lacks information about the successful response. Added return value details to help AI agents understand what data is available after successful file creation.

data.current_description: Creates a file at the specified path in the specified environment. Accepts multipart/form-data content type. Throws an error if a file already exists at the specified path.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new file at the specified path in the specified environment. Accepts multipart/form-data content type. Returns an error if a file already exists at the specified path. Returns the created file metadata including path, size, and creation timestamp.
data.reasoning: Description clearly states the error condition but lacks information about the successful response. Added return value details to help AI agents understand what data is available after successful file creation.

message: Operation 'delete-/cms/v3/source-code/{environment}/content/{path}_archive' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Operation ID suggests archiving behavior but summary/description indicate deletion. Clarified that this is a permanent deletion (not archival). Added side effects (file removal, non-recoverability) and return value information for better AI agent decision-making about operation consequences.

data.current_description: Deletes the file at the specified path in the specified environment.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes the file at the specified path in the specified environment. The file is removed from the source code repository and cannot be recovered. Returns a confirmation response indicating successful deletion.
data.reasoning: Operation ID suggests archiving behavior but summary/description indicate deletion. Clarified that this is a permanent deletion (not archival). Added side effects (file removal, non-recoverability) and return value information for better AI agent decision-making about operation consequences.

Description lacks information about what validation rules are applied, what the response contains, and whether validation has side effects. data.current_summary: Validate the contents of a file
data.current_description: Validates the file contents passed to the endpoint given a specified path and environment. Accepts multipart/form-data content type.
data.description_suggestion: Validates file contents against the specified path and environment configuration. Accepts multipart/form-data content type. Returns validation results including any errors or warnings found. Does not modify the file if validation fails.
data.reasoning: Description lacks information about what validation rules are applied, what the response contains, and whether validation has side effects. Added context about validation scope, return value structure, and clarified that validation is non-destructive to help AI agents understand operation behavior and interpret results.

message: Operation 'post-/cms/v3/source-code/extract/async_doAsync' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_context. Summary doesn't indicate asynchronous nature. Description lacks input details (FileExtractRequest schema), return value specifics (task ID), and clarification that operation is non-blocking. Added async context, input/output details, and reference to TaskLocator schema for better AI agent understanding of operation flow and response handling.

data.current_description: Extract a zip file in the developer file system. Extraction status can be checked with the `/extract/async/tasks/taskId/status` endpoint below.
data.description_suggestion: Asynchronously extracts a zip file into the developer file system. Accepts a FileExtractRequest containing the zip file path and target extraction directory. Returns a task identifier (202 Accepted) that can be used to poll extraction status via the `/extract/async/tasks/{taskId}/status` endpoint. Extraction occurs in the background.
data.reasoning: Summary doesn't indicate asynchronous nature. Description lacks input details (FileExtractRequest schema), return value specifics (task ID), and clarification that operation is non-blocking. Added async context, input/output details, and reference to TaskLocator schema for better AI agent understanding of operation flow and response handling.
